case_vignette: A 38-year-old man comes to the physician because of persistent sadness and difficulty concentrating for the past 6 weeks. During this period, he has also had difficulty sleeping. He adds that he has been “feeling down” most of the time since his girlfriend broke up with him 4 years ago. Since then, he has only had a few periods of time when he did not feel that way, but none of these lasted for more than a month. He reports having no problems with appetite, weight, or energy. He does not use illicit drugs or alcohol. Mental status examination shows a depressed mood and constricted affect.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling persistent sadness and having difficulty concentrating for about 6 weeks now, and I also have had trouble sleeping.
Have you had any changes in your appetite or weight?
No, I haven't had any problems with my appetite or weight.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your life?
Yes, I've been feeling down most of the time since my girlfriend broke up with me 4 years ago.
Have you had any history of depression or anxiety?
I've been feeling down since my breakup 4 years ago, and there have only been a few short periods where I didn't feel this way.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
No, I haven't been taking any medications.
Have you had any family history of depression or anxiety?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history, so I can't say if there's a history of depression or anxiety in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Major Depressive Disorder.
